document.title: Religion Curriculum 2014 Archdiocese of Seattle Catholic Schools

CB15597630A54A02ACDFC50F349F8739.description:
Identify Islam as a religion that shares the Jewish
and Christian belief in one God, monotheism.

0EA6E4037F14428EB4F8BBEFB49E4B08.description:
State the importance of respecting the religious
beliefs of others, while also sharing our beliefs with them in word and
action.

1859714BD5554960A3366326ADA8EA80.description:
Understand the call and the implications of the New
Evangelization.

DAE009C4BF6441519D936819A496C442.description:
CALL TO
ECUMENISM,
INTERFAITH
DIALOGUE AND THE
NEW
EVANGELIZATION
[848-849,927-
933,905,2044,2472]

B68E583831DC485084E6A83AC0DDBFEB.description:
Name talents and gifts from God that holy people in the
New Testament used to serve God’s people, and identify ways to serve
God using the principles of the common good and peace.

ACCA47CEE7EB433FA9FA0DE96EF409CE.description:
State how stewardship is important to the spiritual life of
the parish.

27EF310A04D64A8FB11C5E9AEF7E61BD.description:
CALL TO
STEWARDSHIP AND
SERVICE: Catholic
social teaching about
the common good
[2419-2422]

156E8EA9F56F431BB4BD033BCBCD318B.description:
Identify in Scripture, recite and understand the
implications of the great commission given us by Jesus “Go therefore and
make disciples of all the nations…”

B8529D57C5F340229E37739129721E3A.description:
Recognize the Church is missionary by nature. (See
mission.)

031E2A6034F2474FA7F22FE23FD6DBEB.description:
Identify people in the New Testament who both resisted
and answered God’s calling to discipleship.

A04135AADF0F43E188E01110C0FEEB04.description:
BAPTISMAL CALL AND
DISCIPLESHIP (the
mandate to go forth)
[816,849]
Scripture
Mt. 5:11-12; 28:16-20
Lk. 11:1
Jn. 13:15

6FBD3A97F70B4C72A47B07B75B92864D.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 6: THE CHURCH’S MISSIONARY LIFE AND SERVICE: Students acquire and demonstrate skills to recognize their gifts from God and their
vocation to share the good News of Jesus Christ in word and deed in the world.

5735E17E92B44BD9BFA5DB3E55DBEB27.description:
State how the Magnificat shows God’s power and
justice.

F35A5E4DE1E34EA080FB698887B70D4F.description:
Recognize Mary as a model of prayer and faith for
today.

4FC1C0BFB94D438F9C4433914FD307F6.description:
Explain the titles of Mary, the New Eve, Handmaid of
the Lord, Mother of Christ.

303D14B97DF84FCBBD29DA4D89C9069A.description:
Describe how the Holy Spirit worked through Mary to
prepare the way for the incarnation.

12B998723BE344A3A8A62287CCF9E6E9.description:
Locate and cite passages about Mary in the New
Testament, share how Mary is a model for prayer and discipleship.

430183185E7F4B1382FB257EBE271AC6.description:
Give examples of saints in the early Church who lived out
their covenant relationship with God.

3B8AC128B8824E0CB9F3ACBE628791DE.description:
State the belief that all the faithful in Christ, living and dead,
form the Communion of Saints.

F551B018644A454791749EE386BB4900.description: Celebrate the feast day of the parish patron saint.

A76E96FD913B41DD963D4DC947DCF250.description:
State the call to religious life in the Church is identified in
two forms - active and contemplative.

C24303FC193B4DA2B3E3D0EA1B92D22B.description:
Describe how apostolic religious orders provided
teachers and catechists for parishes in the United States for over 150
years.

9006ADAAC08F4BD5B8CEC8A4D871BA04.description:
Name people in the New Testament who chose to follow
God’s call (vocation) in their lives (e.g. Apostles, Paul, Timothy.)

2FD0F96891E445B480629BF44185768B.description:
Pray to discern one’s life vocation and how their parents,
parish priests, deacons, and vowed religious can help them to discern
about their vocation.

0AC5C6AC523547D4AD55FCBF385FA6E6.description:
Vocation:
Marriage, Priesthood
and the Religious Life
[914-933]
Scripture
Mt. 9:10-13
Mk. 1:16-20
Jn 1:35-51
2 Cor. 4:4

6E75BCE194C147BBA0305ECD5559C5F4.description:
Identify and describe qualities of holy people from the
New Testament as models for our lives.

DB971B0944F64FA689686BDF78277C85.description:

Universal Call to
Holiness
[2013-2014,2028,2813]
Scripture
Mt. 5:48
2 Tim. 4: 1-8
Rm. 8: 28-30

9282790FE26649AE83FA028BF1684F39.description:
Identify qualities and explain how the Holy Family is the
model for all families.

10E145BD88694ACA8F3A25EFF5FDD889.description:
Identify the important components of the domestic
church in Jesus’ family and in our families.

1856955FE5AD4952976556CA7A146AEE.description:
Identify how Jesus was Priest, Prophet and King in the
New Testament and associate this with lay ministries today.

28A97E91A7F041208E1DAE45EA916C63.description:
Articulate how the life of Jesus calls us to live in
community and how membership in the parish is important to my life.

8A8DB60A30D745A2B87E2241CBB7D4B1.description:
Identify the roles of the laity in the Precepts of the
Church.

AE8C242016BA4538AA64A2644EAA1454.description:
Describe the organizational structure of the parish
including bishop, pastor/canonical leader, principal, teacher/catechist.

0E1C1F1B253345E8A37CADB19777B160.description:
Identify New Testament leaders and describe Apostolic
Succession as it was established in the New Testament.

F8FFCC66787E4EEEB34A5106C2C679E6.description:

Order: The Hierarchy -
Magisterium and
Infallibiilty
[874-896]

[871-945]

44F71D19FFE14E1F9C16095D4D55D9CC.description:
State that the Rites of the Catholic Church derive from one
profession of faith, celebration of the seven sacraments and one
hierarchy.

86378E23621047A2B9B90ED071460B7A.description:
Review the structure of the Church and identify how this
structure originates through Jesus with the Apostles.

80CC9BAA983843C89F1A86C7352C8D95.description:

MYSTERY AND MARKS
OF THE CHURCH:
ONE, HOLY, CATHOLIC
AND APOSTOLIC
[811-870]
Scripture
Mt. 16: 13-20

D70912B65B7E47059C12BD1894F58892.description:
Name and explain situations that do and do not honor
chaste living – honoring our bodies as Temples of the Holy Spirit.

D9952EA4ECD34A438458F4B2C391F090.description:
Temple of
the Holy Spirit
[797-801]

Eph. 1:4; 2:21-23;5:25-
27
Mt. 19:6
2:Cor 6:16; 1 Cor 3:16-
17

Read the Pauline passages and identify themes of the
early Church in building the Body of Christ.

F88B48BB7ECB44F5A949167CD9770A82.description: Identify gifts present in the Church today.

3449D5139FAD44DF8EF5A3B571F428E7.description:

throughout the world who are united with God.

God

God
[781-786]

981E5BA472FE4590BAF81E223A4AB7BB.description:
Locate the Epistles and explain New Testament passages
that describe the gifts given in the Early Church.

F856AA62C83449628D74BCAD6E196EDB.description:
Cite examples from the New Testament in which the Early
Church acted as a model community, catalyst, and support for its
members.

B26BAAD5DF3C4F05B2CB718D0E6BD197.description:
Understand and explain how the Catholic Church is worldwide
and includes many cultures and ethnic groups.

C4C952E555634ED08F29CAE2CD81AA43.description:
Explore the lives and describe the special responsibilities of
the apostles and early Church Fathers.

A3897C432D00498C8BAB156B5864AA52.description: Identify the significant role of St. Peter as the first Pope.

BF0AC72B51874467AF5FF981B69BA9ED.description:
Explain how and why the Apostles had a special
responsibility to the Church.

F496CF72617F484AAAE9445DE27CE8B9.description:
Review the structure of the Church and identify how this
structure originates through Jesus with the Apostles.

IN GOD’S PLAN
[748-780

[758-780]

845DDA952CAE4A6EAB459B2BB05F28A0.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 5: EDUCATION FOR COMMUNITY LIFE: Students study and participate in the life and mission of the church, the Body of
Christ and the community of believers, as expressed in the Church’s origin, history, ecclesiology, the Communion of Saints and their family, the domestic church.

140CD4F1D3B8469682EF011466319639.description: Agnus Dei / Behold the Lamb of God

E066105C0C694E1DA102A9C091349025.description: Responses after Scripture readings and Gospel

138DDEC75B554876984B29FF8A9FC495.description: Spontaneous Prayer using “You, Who, Do, Through” sequence

4F503197860847F18FC7EC7CADA0F7F2.description:
Invitatory, Psalm(s) antiphonal style, Doxology - Psalm 8 and
Canticle of Zechariah (Lk 1:68-79) from Liturgy of the Hours

EA94242F4400413A826782EEEC506EF3.description:
Prayers of blessing, adoration, praise, intercession,
thanksgiving, petition

5196A0A425D74C35ABC5C9F87A41FFC2.description:
PRAYERS WE
KNOW BY HEART,
EXPERIENCE AND
SHARE AT MASS

09DF264F90794AE69CD61E936B1A3911.description:
Employ the Lectio Divina model for reflection using: the Letter
of James, Peter 1-2, John 1-3 and Jude.

E92A0AB00D074A1A879165F8ADE15E57.description: Identify the four movements of Lectio Divina.

BC13E517D9E84590AADBA12E34C7138F.description:
Participate in a variety of traditional devotions, and
experience different prayer forms.

7AAAAFF1C92C4E14822D8305D56265BC.description:
Describe that the Church prays the Liturgy of the Hours at
special times of the morning and evening.

C3F218C569D043389B8B8F2BBA927A17.description:
Know, identify in the New Testament, and explain the
Sorrowful Mysteries: Agony in the Garden, Scourging at the Pillar,
Crowing with Thorns, Carrying the Cross, Crucifixion and Death.

8F1B24D57F8346918B279BD801209255.description:
DEVOTIONAL
PRACTICES (e.g.
rosary, stations of the
cross, novenas)
[1200-1209, 1674-1679,
2683-2696]

3A291D4C897E4F1E95280EC1F5A3F6DD.description:
Connect the Seven Petitions in the Our Father with other
passages from the New Testament, making connections between Gospel
themes and Jesus’ actions.

C57E071266AC4EF487501336F43D382E.description:
Explain how the Our Father is a summary of faith and a
model for Christian prayer.

1261795988874D34B5395752748958BD.description:
OUR FATHER: A
Summary of the Gospel
[2746-2865]

Mt. 6:5-15

6CD36FACEE234C5BAD6634D8C300DEAE.description:
Engage in and/or lead a prayer service incorporating one or
more expressions of prayer.

7C64D42080254BD4A28E3E95D8C32048.description: Recognize meditation as important form of prayer.

AAFB5EF3F2564A4BBEE9D79DF1548368.description: Explain how prayer expresses their relationship to God.

42C92F9470754039B85328D435DA85FC.description:
Identify expressions of prayer in the New Testament and
understand their relationship with our Church prayers today.

EF93B5375F85465E959334F475C85E34.description:
EXPRESSIONS OF
PRAYER (vocal,
meditation,
contemplation,
personal and shared)
[2700-2724]

2B0B17BDF62742BA801C4E9EDB335372.description:
Engage in and/or lead a prayer service incorporating one or
more of the forms of prayer using the “You, who, do, through” model.

0E0B895295754ECEA8C99C00EB2DBF92.description:
Identify forms of prayer in the New Testament and
understand their relationship with our Church prayers today.

AC9BCC52182F4CAFB9C1644D79F44161.description: Understand how and when Jesus prayed.

3C3DA6A5FEBA429583E235B756D6EC49.description:
FORMS OF PRAYER
(Blessing, Adoration
Petition, Intercession
Thanksgiving, Praise)
[2623-2649]

9A305E7F7F864AD8AC4074B12B931E27.description:
Explain how prayer can help express their deepest needs, in
times of temptation, and as an act of self-surrender to God.

D98989437A644B33B2DA5FFBD2F4E107.description: Experience Lectio Divina as a way of praying the Gospels.

519247708AD842449892EADE740E9164.description:
Describe how and when Jesus prayed by citing passages
from the New Testament.

2A68E50396D8438888E83C44FBC8515E.description:

CALL TO PRAYER,
IMPORTANCE OF
PRAYER

Mt. 6:9-13; 11:25-26;
14:23
Mk. 1:35
Lk. 6:12; 22:41-44
Jn. 17:1-26

AC9C57A6342A4829A524384C866CB50D.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 4 – TEACHING TO PRAY: Students experience and engage in Catholic expressions of prayer to deepen their relationship
with God and the Church.

DE01980CA544405BAA25C23E146A703A.description:
Identify Scripture that reflects themes of Catholic Social
Teaching, and reflect on the Scripture using the model of encounter,
disturbance and response. (Resource: Maryknoll Missionaries)

6406FF9CEAE64C5EB1BC46F563C4544B.description:
Locate and explain New Testament passages which
contain Jesus’ command to love.

753DAE58D7724DCF83F3E03A4645AD91.description:
Retell a Gospel account in which Jesus’ teaching
confronted his current culture.

314572158B304520A20BD199F69FA676.description:
Use their study of the New Testament to develop an
awareness of current events regarding human suffering and actions that
promote social justice.

4AACFA0B402E49FB8CA8A424C1583037.description:
Identify faith responses to questions about suffering and
promise in the New Testament and in the world today

6AB8E23800E94F66B9AF799FB27F6A3C.description:
Find scriptural examples of Jesus practicing the Works of
Mercy.

371304E022324DDC8C132B0A9D4E9773.description:
Participate in service projects that involve giving of time and
talent to others, articulate how service is essential to being a disciple of
Christ.

77725C69C28E4F3E877A334C6DF90653.description: Give examples of stewardship from their own lives.

116E101EF9F04800866EFDDBB9F5741C.description:
State the importance of Christians taking an active part in
public life building the Kingdom of God and promoting the common
good.

C4575DA6F2444ABCA6494E40AD189BAF.description:
Using scripture stories from the New Testament, identify
rights and responsibilities to care for God’s creation, the poor and
vulnerable (the right to life and the preferential option for the poor.)

30C4DB0E223A4CF3878E02F4EEFC4173.description:
Catholic
Social Teachings –
Consistent Ethic of
Life, Love of
Neighbor, and
Corporal and
Spiritual Works of
Mercy
[2419-2449]
Scripture
Ex. 22:20-26
Mt. 25:31-46
Lk. 4:1-22

EC78D660ED1D4897A60E0BE5A6797F94.description:
Retell a Gospel account in which Jesus’ teaching
confronted the current culture such as the Woman at the Well or the
Good Samaritan.

18E991F579CF45FFAC94ADC84B54E98B.description:
Associate and explain heaven, hell and purgatory with
states after death.

1BFA225FCE5342FE876DA595A0EC521E.description: State how personal sins have social consequences.

8A988EECCA2D4BC4A2BD764ECC064A3D.description: Identify society causes of hunger, disease, poverty.

77D7306E14C54A899F4D4E4F63122A20.description: Describe the effects of Original Sin.

and Social Sin

Ps. 9
Mt. 13:50
Lk. 10:25-37
Jn. 4:5-42

661A2BF691D04C23AB8664517FC33A3D.description:
Find New Testament examples of persons responding to
God’s call to serve God and others.

7F392036C03347E1962AEC2D3398E519.description:
Understand one’s responsibility and ways to serve other
people, especially those in most need.

300012A41D2D4313A901972AF3E05352.description:

Theological Virtues as modeled by Jesus and others in the New
Testament.

9FC50F9529BB45818478AFF2D790D0CD.description:

Cardinal and
Theological

2662]

1 Cor. 13:1-13

F797EB12BDD94F2AA9086E49414E002B.description:
Review how the Old Testament covenant between God and
Abraham is fulfilled in Jesus as He institutes the New Covenant.

236C8E215B254DACBA22C784DC5A9EF3.description:
Identify how the Ten Commandments are a guide for moral
living.

and the Ten
Commandments
[2052-2557]

Ex. 19:16-20:17;
24:1-12
Mt. 22:34-40
Mk. 12:28-34

7E184AA2B9D8410A808DE0CC0A4D3F6F.description:
Describe and use a moral decision making process that
reference both Scripture and the Church’s moral teaching.

F40F0EE096C44BCA84D03CB805908D1C.description:
State the meaning of the maxim that the end does not
justify the means.

4BEE67E00C7A4F1B9032BE74700317E7.description:
Integrate the meaning of the Christian morality with Jesus’
teaching, the dignity of the human person and the Incarnation.

506F74C0BF654592AA499A46ED0BA2C2.description:
Identify the communal impact of sin and explain how sin
can be both commission and omission.

EF4418E2365A4D74B1528C9123F1C9CB.description:
Understand the belief that the Church has the power to
forgive sins through the Sacraments.

8C791F1A65A7401396A962B57D667D9B.description:
Cite New Testament examples of sin and forgiveness, and
explain how turning away from God affects their lives and relationships.

0C514B0F005B4B55A7BFAE7828617050.description:
Identify and cite examples of Jesus’ reaction to sin and
sinners in the Gospels.

B355A981BCFB49BF938D89EC10485B9E.description:
Locate New Testament passages that provide examples of
Jesus helping to form the consciences of believers: Matthew 5.

81977E644A524F488A0E78E618A9D11E.description:
Define morality and understand the three sources of the
morality of human acts: object, intention, and circumstances.

C900648605A340DC98CA5A2FE220FAE5.description:
Define conscience and provide examples of how your
conscience helps guide moral decision making.

36C0AFA237064E6FA58AC0CC5FB478FF.description:

Freedom and
Conscience
Formation
[1030-1037, 1730-
1802]

Mt. 5:1-12
Mk. 2:1-12; 4:1-20
Rm. 2:12-15

0D7FCCEC88C348F2BD4F1FA369CE8E1C.description:
Associate the Beatitudes with current events and people in
society who are building and discovering God’s Kingdom.

2B23D5BE65E747B6B3E9C48923601C04.description:
Name the characteristics of God’s Kingdom found in the
Beatitudes as the fulfillment of the Ten Commandments.

0FCD1D491717490F8E8498A61EBECB7D.description:
Cite New Testament passages that demonstrate the
importance of human dignity.

5AC41DEDC0994DC7967E1746D6152D77.description:

love – to will the good of other people.

B0545C89A5DB4B4589C2DEBF0D8104B6.description:
Explore ways of being models of Christian love in everyday
life.

39918F314A5340AAB8708FF36C048EFD.description:
Identify how we are called to know God and proclaim the
Good News of Jesus Christ by the way we live and act.

D5740B7F416641FA921C681E731D1054.description: Identify how we are created in God’s image.

CA230EB46B074B6F9DE273474EF4C9C8.description:

the Image of God –

1876]

Mt. 7:12; 10:24

99D2AAC3A8014F7AB6424670187E8943.description:
Understand how God’s Natural Law is perfected in the
Sermon on the Mount and leads us to what we must do and what we
must avoid.

9DDCF2A8BFB44B559C02D89CB70622CB.description:
Locate and cite passages from the New Testament where
people expressed a capacity and desire for God.

CCEC3A7D40154650B97D7F7D6C47A13E.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 3 – MORAL EDUCATION: Students develop a moral conscience that is informed by Church teachings and conformed to Christ,
as modeled in a personal life of virtue and demonstrated in service of the Gospel’s demands for society.
Essential Concepts Seventh Grade
New Testament
Eighth Grade

819DE13B78984804892144A5D888DF02.description: Identify and use prayers from the Book of Blessings.

78452C8B50E6429593AFF9AB3103ED8A.description:
Associate New Testament passages with Jesus blessing
people, weddings and dying people.

A0186067089542F1A37229F74AB829DB.description: Compare the funeral rite with the Paschal mystery.

Rites: Weddings,
[1621-1637]
Funerals, [988-1029,
1680-1690] and
Blessings [1671-
1673]

16F891CE9FA743E2A870051FA3AE28C4.description:
Experience the Liturgy of the Hours using Shorter
Christian Prayer format for morning prayer, lauds or evening prayer,
vespers.

FFE191AA83BF44BFBA6E1267222887B5.description:
Antiphonally pray psalms from the Liturgy of the Hours
including those learned in previous grades and Psalm 8. Pray and reflect
on the Canticle of Zachariah from the Liturgy of the Hours.

E3C6F35D2AB943FEA48644125FF7008D.description:
Describe the Liturgy of the Hours as the public prayer of
the Church and know that it is prayed across the globe every day.

0D4E6A17AAF441329C247612224B0C85.description:

Liturgy of the Hours

of Zechariah
Lk 1:46-55 (Canticle
of Mary, the

7598A804446C4C189861E58E62BF2C60.description:
Recognize the scriptural roots of some sacramentals we
use today.

EA8D2706A2B14919A1DD8702D8940573.description: Identify and use sacramentals to encourage faith in Jesus.

EDDF156FD795400AAEE871EDACE542BE.description:
Identify some of the solemnity, feasts and memorials in
the Liturgical Calendar.

DDA65F2B1BE24749B7AA42A4D7FDC50E.description:
Explain how the Triduum liturgies deepen their
understanding of the Passion of our Lord.

6897F2D3E28744DD9478C679453A5359.description:
Make connections between New Testament events and the
Liturgical Calendar.

C160CD427CFE44E3B3455DE68969FE23.description:
Identify the liturgical seasons and the cycle of readings in
the Catholic Church.

A9145058A8D347518D10A96E9E8CFF77.description:
Cite and explain the passage in the Acts of the Apostles
describing the ordination of the first deacons.

B45EAF4899354AB0AA7C7515A87ED7CB.description:
Recall the Sacrament of Holy Orders as a vocation through
the Sacrament at the Service of Communion for God and his people.

6E80CB25063B425B86E075E1A3D7D167.description:
Understand and explain that Catholic marriages are called
to witness to the Trinitarian love of Christ.

22E55E4BB75B48B0BC23E26755E64879.description:
Sacraments
at the Service of
Communion
[1533-1666]
Scripture
1 Peter 2:9
Mk. 12:28-34
Act 6:1-6

7ED7267314B64F2999EE8EDCAE754B1D.description:
Prepare and participate in the Sacrament of Reconciliation
and relate the importance of this sacrament now and throughout life.

6073116665754EF8986B0B4EEA6E4C30.description:
Find evidence of anointing and healing in the New
Testament.

7A1D89FF99654E0EA665405CC5E2D02D.description:
Recognize Jesus’ baptism wherein the Holy Spirit anoints and
God the Father proclaims Jesus as the “beloved” who will fulfill the
mission of salvation

3E6FF4D40F9E47FE900AB519EB358E2D.description:
Locate a New Testament passage that describes the
Sacraments of Initiation.

3FD6AEB7750A4BE587A7DBD704807979.description:
Recognize and give examples of how the Sacraments are
rooted in the New Testament.

29D78EE0F68C4133A9024ADD7694CA9C.description: Articulate how sacraments help us live a life of faith.

4A5DE957745644518320491ADB18AB42.description: Associate the Last Supper with the Mass.

DDB38C016F5F4FF597386AF004D177ED.description: Associate transubstantiation to the Liturgy of the Eucharist.

1C594346D57E4EEEB03497C2098B7E54.description:
Experience the different Eucharistic prayers and cite New
Testament scripture passages that pertain to the Eucharist.

2EC202E8A5924592BC2F9D78FC558FB1.description: Define Lectionary, Sacramentary and Book of Blessings.

61443E2BE55E4CC4B60E75FF7E0D99FE.description:
Review and understand that the synoptic Gospels makeup the
Cycles A, B and C of the readings during Sunday Mass and the use of
John’s Gospel annually.

3C67ADFD57934D3D82680169A6D7A39A.description:
Articulate and demonstrate the meaning of full, active and
conscious participation in the liturgy.

50F22B31115941AD8A610A313B2A3E30.description:
EUCHARIST
 Who, How, When,
and Where the Mass
is Celebrated
[1135-1167, 1322-
1419]
Scripture:
Mt. 26:25-30
Mk. 14:12-26
Lk. 22:14-20
Jn. 6:32-58
Act 2:42-47

AD6A7F36CE5F432AAE7B03D243E5E130.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 2 – LITURGICAL EDUCATION: Students recognize the presence of Christ and enter into communion with Him through active, full and
conscious participation in the Liturgical celebrations and Sacraments of the Church.

4D496DA7FFAA4C75BA5E3C5AFEECB943.description:
Articulate as a statement in the creeds the belief in the Trinity,
the One God of the Old and New Testament, Father, as the creator of all;
Jesus, as living, dying and rising to save us from our sins, and the Holy
Spirit as the ongoing presence of God living in the Church and each of us.

4C3F4C305FE4450C9BE2A11EDE5BB018.description:
Recognize the statement, “He descended into hell,” confesses
that Jesus did really die and through his death for us conquered death
and the devil “who has the power of death” (Heb 2:14).

F42E30BF52FA4F279C39357D6B11AE7C.description:
Cite New Testament verses that are included in the Apostles
and Nicene Creeds.

FDBE515B65E84B06A0B98D5CE01AAC48.description:
Locate and cite passages in the New Testament that include
all the person(s) of the Holy Trinity, e.g. Baptism of Christ; sending of the
Paraclete.

A2E38D128124432A80929F5B6005AC69.description:
Identify the actions of the Holy Spirit in the prayer of the Early
Church.

291E37F61472428085AA687B1905C20D.description:
Describe the resurrection of the dead as essential to
Christianity: We have risen with Christ in Baptism and participate in the
life of the Risen Christ.

CDC38D800100410C9FA648D767E64B80.description:
Name and define the characteristics of God: eternal,
omniscient, omnipotent, and omnipresent.

14D9FCA06DAF42C0B7FD7194DA247713.description:
Describe how through the love and life of Jesus Christ we have
been redeemed by God’s mercy and love of the Holy Spirit.

883144DEB5A241AE81B9A84BC710CB41.description:
Recall that although God is named Father, Son, and Holy Spirit,
each is wholly and entirely God.

8E8EB0FCB3A34E169B768EDDE3A6DABF.description:
Begin to recognize we can know characteristics of God, but our
understanding of God will always be limited as our human words can
never explain the mystery of God.

C8372716D5924DA4AFD43EF665C3C55D.description:
Articulate that the central mystery of the Christian faith is the
Holy Trinity, Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.

B6ED321DFF21432BA1AAEAD850297402.description:
TRINITY
God the Father, Creator
God the Son,
Redeemer
God the Holy Spirit,
Sanctifier
[249-324]
Scripture
Mt. 3:13-17
Acts 2:1-42
Ex. 3:1-17

6289B8D3C5694FE589EBFA9DB112472B.description:
Use the Gospels to understand Jesus’ ministry as one who
teaches, forgives, and heals in the name of the Father.

724F925E524A41FB9550151FBEBDD8D0.description: Understand the purpose of parables in the ministry of Jesus.

5D26C627745846BA8C98D8B955E88FD1.description:
Review and understand the appearances of Jesus after his
resurrection found in the Gospels and in Acts.

3F594D84ACF848A6910DDF998577E3AC.description:
Trace and compare the stories of the life, death, and
Resurrection of Jesus found in the Synoptic Gospels.

B18E44E66E2D4C9585893D567ED18706.description:
Explain the meaning of “synoptic” and how the synoptic
Gospels differ from the Gospel of John.

221CA28664884EA5A9522A8CAA769AF3.description:
Retell stories from the New Testament in which Jesus is
acknowledged as both divine and human. (hypostatic union)

C2D93D51D24A42C28DD7DF08CFE2BA06.description:
Compare the accounts of the suffering, death, and
resurrection of Jesus found in the Gospels.

B5FA6C8C9AC646F79E9266A1491F79DB.description: Understand the role of John the Baptist as precursor to Jesus.

395C8B7F3DC7422B988F5619F83261A0.description:
Understand the importance of the genealogy of Jesus found
in Matthew 1.

B23E018ADBBC4E7184D85746BD218E42.description:
Exhibit an understanding that Jesus fulfills the promises made
in the Old Testament. (typology)

453719296CC042D7B262A4F4B2571E59.description:
Locate and cite passages in the New Testament related to
key events in Salvation History.

CA1E5E22502A4FD09E5C63A50808782F.description:
Define the term “tradition” as it is used in the Catholic
Church.

7A41AC417A0D4388AB806A0B3E3BABC5.description:
Identify the “Catholic Letters” in the New Testament: Letter
of James, Peter 1 and 2, John 1, 2, and 3, Jude

0588B6042E0C43199A6DB0DCE4878350.description:
Describe the distinction of the books of the New Testament
separated into four categories: Gospels, Acts, Letters and Revelation.
7-KF-R-1 Compare and contrast the Infancy Narratives in Matthew and
Luke.

F847D1B6A11F40EDBC0BEFD735079FE0.description:
Cite different teachings from the New Testament concerning
the Paschal Mystery and discipleship.

84CDC02E1C604774922C51DAF1AD6009.description: Find characteristics of God’s Kingdom in the New Testament.

8C2FBD34738A4B99B6096DEDF6E1749C.description:
Differentiate between divinely inspired truth and literal fact
when interpreting Sacred Scripture.

B5E1671C9D4C47E0BDE66D89EE89FC3A.description:
Describe the distinction of the books of the New Testament
separated into four categories: Gospels, Acts, Letters and Revelation.

FE2CD30FB02348249F4AF25B0B8A8E3A.description:
List the twenty-seven books in the New Testament and where
to find them.

A1C7BD6854324065B261482D6D72521B.description:
Understand and explain the structure and organization of the
New Testament.

A89778A4905A4B8393EAAAACE8391942.description:
Describe how God’s Natural Law helps us listen to our own
sacred story to follow Jesus Christ.

5E29957325494F46A12F565E9D7796AD.description:
Understand that God reveals Himself over time and in human
history.

F93B62EB38A34057A40082660153BF08.description:
State the meaning of divine inspiration, magisterium,
authentic interpretation of Scripture, canon and inerrancy.

633C7CE376B34E9FA4BDC7934F1CC4C6.description:
Locate and cite passages in the New Testament that highlight
God’s desire to reveal Himself to us.

87483A9292804A2A83DDD280157DEB70.description:
TASK OF CATECHESIS 1 – KNOWLEDGE OF THE FAITH: Students explore, profess and reflect on our Catholic faith, which is the content of God’s revelation found in
Sacred Scripture and Sacred Tradition and lived out in the Creed and Church doctrine.
